phrases: On the fourth day of the Grand Magic Games,
in one of the battle part's tag matches,
a showdown between four Dragon Slayers is happening.
It is Natsu and Gajeel vs. Sting and Rogue.
The battle against the Twin Dragons of Sabertooth,
a battle that puts Fairy Tail's bond and pride on the line, has begun at last!
I can take both of you on by myself.
Go ahead, attack me at the same time!
Now Natsu Dragneel of Fairy Tail
is challenging the two of them to a battle!
Although Natsu is the one who is fighting...
He is in the stadium again, is not he?
Do not let him get away this time!
I am concerned about the match, but right now...
You can take us on by yourself?
You are just messin' with us...
I have no business with you.
You want Gajeel, you got to go through me.
Force is the power of a dragon.
There is nothing more powerful in this world!
I wonder what is happening with the match...
Natsu and Gajeel are winnin', of course!
I understand if you are worried,
but it is your job to rest up
and regain your strength and magic.
Knowing Natsu-san, I am sure he will be fine, right?
They are so tough, they should have a plaque with that word hanging on a wall, right?
This is the power I used to kill Vicelogia!
Then I will use my power...
Those two definitely are not weak,
but Natsu responds to stronger opponents by becoming more powerful than he already is.
That guy's a blockhead, but when it comes to fighting, his mind is a steel trap.
Damn, how strong is that guy?
I am scared of what will happen when he comes back...
I have no memory of seeing the power of the Dragon Force losing ground like this.
Please let me be your disciple!
I want to get strong, too!
Are not you scared of me?
The quality of the magic has changed again.
The magic of those two has begun to merge.
In the end, I was not able to get strong,
but I love watching strong Sting-kun!
have combined perfectly into one power.
There are walls that power alone cannot break through...
Yajima-san, what the heck is that?!
It is high level magic that in general cannot be mastered
even if you devote your whole life to it.
This is the power of the Twin Dragons...
You here to see him off?
I am going to head out.
Then I will see ya later!
I am not going to say anything!
I am not going to say anything!
It is Fiore's strongest guild, Sabertooth, vs.
the strongest guild seven years ago, Fairy Tail!
And taking the challenge of this tag battle are four dragons!
Although one of them has gone off somewhere...
Natsu and the Twin Dragons are locked in fierce battle!
No... I feel a strange pressure.
And I will win it for sure.
I have ever since I joined the guild.
What are you talking about, pressure?
What are you two doing, a husband-and-wife comedy routine?!
No matter how far away he is,
he will always be watching over me...
You are surrounded by such good children...
There are walls that cannot be broken through power alone.
But if there is a power that can break through those walls,
It looks like the mega-moves of both sides ended the match...
It is like an earthquake here!
Apparently, the live feed lacrima is experiencing technical difficulties,
so please sit tight a little longer!
I do not feel any magic...
It seems Lacrima-Vision is back up!
The last one standing is Natsu Dragneel!
A guild is a place that nurtures feelings.
With this, they have leaped to first place!
And this brings an end to the fourth day of the Grand Magic Games!
After one day off, we will be back the day after tomorrow with the final battle!
Which guild will achieve victory in the end?!
I figured it would turn out like this!
That is what I expected, I guess I should say...
Our goal for the final day has changed!
Let us have some fun, Natsu-kun...
I cannot believe those two lost...
This will keep us in the spotlight for a while.
I will give this match to you.
After this one, we are going to keep winning anyway.
We are not going to miss one or two points.
Do not cry about that one point later, kid!
If Gajeel has the same fighting strength as Natsu...
I got to hurry up and tell Lucy!
Today, I will give you honest praise, Natsu.
You gave us a good show, but what happened to Gajeel?!
He took off during the middle of it!
Does not he know the meaning of tag battle?!
Have you forgotten what you did?!
Get plenty of rest tomorrow to prepare for the final day's survival battle.
I am going to win it for sure!
After that, I am going to fight you two, Erza and Gray!
I think you are putting the horse before the carriage or whatever...
Are not you going to ask how it turned out?
I have believed in you since I first joined the guild.
We have made it this far.
Although we were off to a rotten start in last place on the first day...
And laughed at and we got frustrated.
But now we are one step away from victory!
We are going to turn it around from zero!
He said to save our tears for when we win!
Let us climb to the top!
Give up are not in our vocabulary!
That is not what it is about!
Let us aim to be the number one guild in Fiore!
A lot's happened since I joined the guild,
but I am so glad I did!
This is what Fairy Tail is about!
Anyway, where the hell am I?
Do not tell me he got away again?
I put some distance between us, and I am on his trail.
I am thinking I will make my move where there are not any other people around.
You are not getting away this time...
You possess magic similar to Zeref's...
You must have mixed feelings, Sergeant Yukino.
I no longer feel any attachment to the guild.
That aside, I just cannot get used to being addressed as Sergeant.
If my power may be of use, then I am prepared to wield it to the utmost.
For the sake of Arcadios-sama, too, who invited me to join.
I suppose I should refer to him as Colonel.
And his old friends call him Dio.
But he is socially awkward, is not he?
Even though he is trying to save the world,
no one is aware of it...
Again, that premonition of the castle in ruins...
If we keep it up, we might actually win this thing!
There is no way those members can lose!
By the way, have you seen Gajeel?
He has not come back yet?
I bet he is off chowin' down on iron somewhere.
He will be back sooner or later.
That day, we believed in victory.
The final day was a really hard-fought battle.
